NBSD Press Release - May 18, 2020

The North Bend School District would like to announce the retirement of two district administrators, Mr. Ralph Brooks and Mr. Bill Lucero, at the end of the current school year.

In his career with North Bend School District, Ralph worked as a teacher, coach, middle school vice principal, and principal at the middle school.

Bill worked as a teacher, coach, middle school vice principal, and principal at the high school.

Collectively these school leaders have dedicated sixty (60) years of service to North Bend Schools and our community!

This announcement leaves North Bend Middle School with a substantial change in leadership for the coming year. The school district will announce next steps and plans for filling the positions after the state economic forecast announcement on May 20, 2020.

Please join the North Bend School community in congratulating Bill and Ralph and wishing them the best on their future adventures!

Teachers have been working around the clock learning new tools to use in their "virtual classrooms". The Geology Lecture Series at SWOCC presents: Imminent Shaking: What Kind of Earthquake Prediction is Possible? Join Dr. Sarah Minson (US Geological Survey) for the 15th Annual Cascadia Anniversary talk at 7 p.m., Friday, January 24th at the Hales Center for Performing Arts.
This talk in the Hales Center on the SWOCC Campus is free and open to everyone in the community. For more info check out: https://www.socc.edu/blog/2020/01/13/geology-lecture-imminent-shaking-what-kind-of-earthquake-prediction-is-possible/. The talk will also be livestreamed and archived on the college website: www.socc.edu. For more info contact Ron Metzger at 541-888-7216 or at rmetzger@socc.edu.

At Noon on Friday, January 24th Dr. Minson will be giving a talk directed to students to discuss: Her pathway to STEM, what coursework students should take to prepare for a STEM degree/career and an overview of the USGS (United States Geological Survey). With extensive question and answer session for students. This talk/discussion will also be livestreamed and archived on the college website: www.socc.edu.
